Class Pen

java.lang.Object
  Pen

public class Pen
extends java.lang.Object

Pens Project, Version 1 A Pen is a tool for drawing straight lines in a canvas. Pens are constrained to move in four directions: North, South, East, and West. This class is loosely based on the Smalltalk Pen class and various Turtle Graphics packages that are available for different languages.

Version:
1.05, March 19, 2009.
Author:
D.L. Bailey Department of Systems and Computer Engineering, Carleton University

Constructor Summary
Pen()
          Constructs a new blue Pen in the down position, placed in the middle of the canvas, and pointing East (i.e., by default, it will move horizontally towards the right of the canvas).

Constructor Detail

Pen

public Pen()
Constructs a new blue Pen in the down position, placed in the middle of the canvas, and pointing East (i.e., by default, it will move horizontally towards the right of the canvas).

Method Detail

changeColour

public void changeColour(java.lang.String newColour)
Changes this pen's colour to the specified colour.

Parameters:
newColour - The pen's new colour. Valid colors are "red", "black", "blue", "yellow", "green", "magenta" and "white". If an invalid colour is specified, the pen's colour doesn't change.

colour

public java.lang.String colour()
Returns this pen's colour.

Returns:
The colour of the lines that the pen draws.

direction

public int direction()
Returns the pen's current direction.

Returns:
the direction in which the pen will move.

down

public void down()
Places the pen down on the canvas. If the pen was already down, invoking this method does not change the pen's state.

isDown

public boolean isDown()
Determines if the pen is in the down position.

Returns:
true if the pen is down on the canvas, false otherwise.

isUp

public boolean isUp()
Determines if the pen is in the up position.

Returns:
true if the pen is not on the canvas, false otherwise.

move

public void move()
Moves the pen by 20 pixels in the current direction. If the pen is down, draws a straight line between the old and new pen locations.

moveBy

public void moveBy(int distance)
Moves the pen by the specified number of pixels in the current direction. If the pen is down, draws a straight line between the old and new pen locations. The pen is not moved if the specified distance is <= 0.

Parameters:
distance - The distance the pen will be moved from its current location.

place

public void place(int newX,
                  int newY)
Places the pen at the specified coordinates. No line is drawn, regardless of whether the pen is up or down.

Parameters:
newX - the x coordinate of the pen's new location.
newY - the y coordinate of the pen's new location.

turnClockwise

public void turnClockwise()
Turns the pen clockwise by 90 degrees: N -> E -> S -> W -> N.

turnCounterClockwise

public void turnCounterClockwise()
Turns the pen counterclockwise by 90 degrees: N -> W -> S -> E -> N.

up

public void up()
Picks the pen up from the canvas. If the pen was already up, invoking this method does not change the state of the pen.

xLocation

public int xLocation()
Returns the x-coordinate of the pen's location on the canvas.

Returns:
the x-coordinate of the pen's location.

yLocation

public int yLocation()
Returns the y-coordinate of the pen's location on the canvas.

Returns:
the y-coordinate of the pen's location.
